holidays.name: World Kindness Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to promoting kindness in all its forms, encouraging people around the globe to be nicer to one another and spread goodwill.
holidays.origin: Initiated by the World Kindness Movement in 1998 to highlight good deeds in the community, focusing on the positive power of kindness.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that performing a single act of kindness can boost your happiness for up to 12 hours!

holidays.name: Pickle Day
holidays.description: A crunchy celebration of all things pickled ‚Äî cucumbers, onions, even pickled plums if you're adventurous! This day is a sour-sweet homage to preserved veggies.
holidays.origin: While the exact origin is murky, Pickle Day has been embraced by pickle lovers and pickle-makers to honor this salty snack.
holidays.funFact: Pickles were so prized in the past that seafarers considered them essential for preventing scurvy on long voyages.

holidays.name: World Pneumonia Day
holidays.description: An awareness day focusing on pneumonia prevention, treatment, and the global fight against this serious lung infection.
holidays.origin: Established in 2009 by the Global Coalition against Child Pneumonia to boost public awareness and policy focus.
holidays.funFact: Despite advances in medicine, pneumonia remains the leading infectious cause of death in children worldwide.

holidays.name: National Blame Someone Else Day
holidays.description: A cheeky unofficial observance where it's totally acceptable to avoid responsibility by pinning your goofs on someone else! (Just this once.)
holidays.origin: Believed to have started as a humorous American holiday to lighten the mood about our mistakes.
holidays.funFact: This day usually falls on the Friday before Thanksgiving, perfect timing for a little workplace mischief!
